page.title: 05FARMING - CROPS
page.content: The crops grown in this area are mainly cereals, such as wheat and barley; the majority of which is used as cattle feed. A small quantity is sold for grinding into flour for bread and biscuit making. A highly intensive cropping system operates. The bulk is winter-sown and then sprayed to kill weeds in the winter or early spring. It is also fertilised with a nitrogen-based chemical in early spring. The crop is gathered by combine harvester in the following August. This machinery does all the threshing and separating and the grain is then dried and sold. During the 1980's more and more land which was once thought to be too steep to cultivate is being ploughed and sown for a cereal crop instead of being left as grass for grazing for cattle and sheep.
